Name: credit_days
Description:
Custom credit days for the contact.
If returned as null in a GET response, you may want to GET /invoice_settings and use 'customer_credit_days'/'vendor_credit_days' as default/fallback according to your use case.

Name: credit_limit
Description:
Custom credit limit amount for the contact
not applicable to Start

Name: credit_terms
Description:
Credit terms options determine how invoice due dates are calculated.
Options include: end of next month, a delay of supplier credit_days and immediately.
Only: month_end_invoice, date_from_invoice, immediate_invoice, month_end_payment,
date_from_payment, immediate_payment are valid values.
If returned as null in a GET response, you may want to GET /invoice_settings
and use 'customer_credit_terms'/'vendor_credit_terms' as default.

Name: credit_terms_and_conditions
Description:
Custom terms and conditions for the contact. If set will override global /invoice_settings default terms and conditions.
Customers only

Description: The API path for the resource

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.balance_details
Description: The ledger account balance details for the date range provided

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.cis_labour
Description: Indicates whether the ledger account is flagged for CIS Labour

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.cis_materials
Description: Indicates whether the ledger account is flagged for CIS Materials

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.control_name
Description:
The control name for the ledger account.

This is used internally by Accounting to identify the correct ledger account for booking taxes etc.
You cannot add ledger accounts with control name and you cannot modify the control name of existing
ledger accounts.

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.created_at
Description: The datetime when the item was created

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.display_formatted
Description: The display name formatted based on coa_list_order in settings

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.display_name
Description: The display name for the ledger account

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.displayed_as
Description: The name of the resource

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.fixed_tax_rate
Description: Indicates whether the default tax rate is fixed or may be changed per transaction

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.gifi_code
Description:
The GIFI code of the ledger account.

GIFI is short for The General Index of Financial Information and it lets the CRA validate tax information electronically instead of manually.
Information from financial statements is categorized under the appropriate 4-digit-long GIFI code and entered on corporate income tax returns.
GIFI is needed when filing a T2 income tax return.

_Canada only_

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.id
Description: The unique identifier for the item

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.included_in_chart
Description: Indicates whether the ledger account is included in the chart of accounts

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.is_control_account
Description:
Indicates whether the ledger account is a control account.

Control accounts cannot be removed. See also `control_name`.

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.ledger_account_classification
Description: The ledger account classification for the ledger account

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.ledger_account_group
Description: The ledger account group for the account

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.ledger_account_type
Description: The ledger account type for the ledger account

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.name
Description:
The name for the ledger account.

Changes to this field do not propagate to other resources, namely not to the name of the associated
bank_account (unlike the behaviour of the UI).

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.nominal_code
Description: The nominal code of the ledger account

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.tax_recoverable
Description: Indicates that transactions posted to this ledger account have part recoverable taxes (Canada only)

Name: default_purchase_ledger_account.visible_scopes
Description:
The visible scopes for the ledger account.

This indicates in which of the UI's areas the ledger account is displayed and available for user
selection. Possible entries in this array are `bank`, `sales`, `purchasing`, `other_payment`,
`other_receipt`, `reporting`, `journals`, `sales_eu`, `sales_row`, `purchasing_eu`, `purchasing_row`
and `purchasing_hrc`.

Description: The API path for the resource

Name: usual_supplier.aux_reference
Description:
Auxiliary reference. Used for German 'Kreditorennummer' and 'Debitorennummer'.
See Datev Settings endpoint reference

Name: usual_supplier.auxiliary_account
Description:
Auxiliary account - used when auxiliary accounting is enabled in business settings.
Available only in Spain and France

Name: usual_supplier.balance
Description: The contact balance

Name: usual_supplier.cis_registered
Description:
Identifies a contact as being registered as CIS.
only applicable to UK business

Name: usual_supplier.contact_types
Description: The type of the contact. It has to be either CUSTOMER or VENDOR

Name: usual_supplier.created_at
Description: The datetime when the item was created

Name: usual_supplier.credit_days
Description:
Custom credit days for the contact.
If returned as null in a GET response, you may want to GET /invoice_settings and use 'customer_credit_days'/'vendor_credit_days' as default/fallback according to your use case.

Name: usual_supplier.credit_limit
Description:
Custom credit limit amount for the contact
not applicable to Start

Name: usual_supplier.credit_terms
Description:
Credit terms options determine how invoice due dates are calculated.
Options include: end of next month, a delay of supplier credit_days and immediately.
Only: month_end_invoice, date_from_invoice, immediate_invoice, month_end_payment,
date_from_payment, immediate_payment are valid values.
If returned as null in a GET response, you may want to GET /invoice_settings
and use 'customer_credit_terms'/'vendor_credit_terms' as default.

Name: usual_supplier.credit_terms_and_conditions
Description:
Custom terms and conditions for the contact. If set will override global /invoice_settings default terms and conditions.
Customers only

Name: usual_supplier.deletable
Description: Indicates whether the contact can be deleted successfully

Name: usual_supplier.deleted_at
Description: The datetime when the item was deleted

Name: usual_supplier.destination_vat_blocking
Description: Identifies a contact should be blocked due to destination vat

Name: usual_supplier.displayed_as
Description: The name of the resource

Name: usual_supplier.email
Description: The email address for the given contact

Name: usual_supplier.gb_based
Description: Identifies a contact as being based in Great Britain.

Name: usual_supplier.gdpr_obfuscated
Description: General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) came into effect on 25th May 2018. It introduces new rules for how business owners manage their contacts' personal data. When this field returns 'true', means that the contact has been requested to be obfuscated and you can not create any artifact (sales invoices, purchase invoices, ...) but you can still check previously created artifacts.

Name: usual_supplier.has_unfinished_recurring_invoices
Description: Indicates whether the contact is associated with any unfinished recurring invoices

Name: usual_supplier.id
Description: The unique identifier for the item

Name: usual_supplier.is_active
Description: Identifies a contact as being active

Name: usual_supplier.links
Description: Links for the resource

Name: usual_supplier.locale
Description: The locale for the contact

Name: usual_supplier.name
Description: The contact's full name or business name

Name: usual_supplier.ni_based
Description: Identifies a contact as being based in Northern Ireland.

Name: usual_supplier.notes
Description: The notes for the contact

Name: usual_supplier.reference
Description: Unique reference for the contact

Name: usual_supplier.registered_number
Description: The registered number of the contact's business. Only used for German businesses and represents the 'Steuernummer' there (not the 'USt-ID').

Name: usual_supplier.source_guid
Description: Used when importing contacts from external sources

Name: usual_supplier.system
Description: Identifies a contact as being a system contact used for processing specific transaction types and reserved specifically for those transaction types such as tax return payments/refunds.

Name: usual_supplier.tax_calculation
Description:
France: The tax calculation method used to define tax treatment Vendors only
Spain: Defines if contact is a retailer and tax is subject to Recargo de Equivalencia Customers only United Kingdom: Defines if contact tax treatment is domestic reverse charge Customers & Suppliers

Name: usual_supplier.tax_number
Description: The VAT registration number of the contact. The format will be validated.

Name: usual_supplier.updated_at
Description: The datetime when the item was last updated

Description: The total amount of CIS deductible labour - only applicable in UK

Description: General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) came into effect on 25th May 2018. It introduces new rules for how business owners manage their contacts' personal data. When this field returns 'true', means that the contact has been requested to be obfuscated and you can not create any artifact (sales invoices, purchase invoices, ...) but you can still check previously created artifacts.

Name: usual_supplier.has_unfinished_recurring_invoices
Description: Indicates whether the contact is associated with any unfinished recurring invoices

Name: usual_supplier.id
Description: The unique identifier for the item

Name: usual_supplier.is_active
Description: Identifies a contact as being active

Name: usual_supplier.links
Description: Links for the resource

Name: usual_supplier.locale
Description: The locale for the contact

Name: usual_supplier.name
Description: The contact's full name or business name

Name: usual_supplier.ni_based
Description: Identifies a contact as being based in Northern Ireland.

Name: usual_supplier.notes
Description: The notes for the contact

Name: usual_supplier.reference
Description: Unique reference for the contact

Name: usual_supplier.registered_number
Description: The registered number of the contact's business. Only used for German businesses and represents the 'Steuernummer' there (not the 'USt-ID').

Name: usual_supplier.source_guid
Description: Used when importing contacts from external sources

Name: usual_supplier.system
Description: Identifies a contact as being a system contact used for processing specific transaction types and reserved specifically for those transaction types such as tax return payments/refunds.

Name: usual_supplier.tax_calculation
Description:
France: The tax calculation method used to define tax treatment Vendors only
Spain: Defines if contact is a retailer and tax is subject to Recargo de Equivalencia Customers only United Kingdom: Defines if contact tax treatment is domestic reverse charge Customers & Suppliers

Name: usual_supplier.tax_number
Description: The VAT registration number of the contact. The format will be validated.

Name: usual_supplier.updated_at
Description: The datetime when the item was last updated
